p: The use of Wolbachia is recommended by the World Mosquito Program to eliminate dengue. A trial in Australia has demonstrated that, shortly after release of Wolbachia-infected Aedes mosquitoes, over 90% of the mosquitoes population at the site became Wolbachia-infected, and the transmission of DENV was stopped [25]. Similar trials are being conducted in Viet Nam, Indonesia and Brazil. The fear that Wolbachia infection of Ae aegypti would lead to its replacement by Ae albopictus seems unwarranted so far, but it requires further studies.
